name: Residence Inn Portsmouth Downtown / Waterfront

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: My husband and I, along with 4 other couples, stayed at the Residence Inn in downtown Portsmouth this past weekend which was our second stay there in 2 years. The hotel is within walking distance to all the great downtown restaurants and pubs. The rooms are immaculate, all with full kitchens, and the hotel staff are all so friendly and helpful. Many thanks to Heather, always smiling and ready to greet our group, and who was so helpful in giving us directions to the area restaurants. The complimentary breakfast buffet each morning had many different choices and is one of the nicer hotel buffets we have been to. We are all looking forward to staying there again in the near future.

reviews.title: Great place; wish we had a bathtub
reviews.text: We have stayed at other Residence Inns and they've been great with all the no charge amenities and upscale decor. We usually prefer not to stay at chains but we like this one. Portsmouth's Residence Inn has a great location and lived up to the standard.

reviews.title: Much more than we expected..!
reviews.text: You get a gorgeous breakfast (real fresh fruit, real oatmeal, eggs, egg whites, toppings, meats, yogurts, good juices, breads, danishes, make your own waffles. The breakfast area is the lounge area the rest of the time, not some windowless room. It's a cool/bar setting with comfy chairs and good vibe.

reviews.title: Home away from home...
reviews.text: We were in a large 1 BR. There was a king in the BR, and a sofa bed in the full kitchen/living area. 2 TV's. They brought in an cot for our teenager so she wouldn't have to share the sofa bed with her brother. If you need one, make sure you request this when you reserve. Both rooms were big, well lit and nicely furnished. What I couldn't figure out is why there was no bathtub. There was plenty of room. I didn't want to change rooms, and I learned that some rooms have baths, some don't. So...there's my tip for you. If you like a bath, ask. The front desk gave me shower caps on request; the rooms are not stocked with them.

reviews.title: Excellence from Marriott
reviews.text: The location is perfect. It's walking distance to all the nice shops, historic sites, the waterfront, everything. I don't think you could do better. Other reviewers have discussed the parking and I have a tip. If you don't want to valet, if you can find a meter, you can park for $1/hr (some take credit cards) and then they are free overnight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a one night stay at the Residence Inn with 3 other couples. As mentioned in the other reviews, the hotel is very centrally located, and we were able to walk all over the city. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and the rooms are immaculate. We loved the large suite which had a great kitchen area with a full size fridge, microwave, stovetop, dishwasher, plus all kitchen essentials in the cabinets. We will definitely stay there again in the future.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a fun city

reviews.text: We were very pleasantly surprised by how great this Residence Inn was. I have stayed at several other Residence Inns, and none have even come close to this one. It felt very new, and had a great fun modern feel to it. The room was great. The bathroom was beautiful with a huge modern tiled shower. The decoration in the rest of room was also done very well. I particularly liked the lighting. The breakfast was on par with other Residence Inns, but was better staffed and stocked than usual. And, one of the very best parts of this hotel is the great location. It is within walking distance to all of downtown Portsmouth, which is great. We were in town for a job interview, and I think the stay at this hotel influenced our decision to move to NH.
reviews.title: Wonderful Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here this past weekend to celebrate Valentine's Day and may I just say that this hotel rocks!! It's SUPER close to everything in downtown Portsmouth (shops, restaurants, etc). It's BRAND new, awesome little gym, flat screens in the room, cookies at the front desk, and so much more. The breakfast buffet is so good too and it's free every morning for guests. Only downside is no free parking; you have to pay 18 bucks a day for the lot across from the hotel if you want peace of mind or you can continue to move your car every 4 hours on the street. The Sheraton is another of our favorites and has free parking but this hotel was much nicer!
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: This is the best Residence Inn I have ever stay in. Maybe because it is almost brand new. The beds are comfortable and they new rooms are great. Only two downsides. The windows on the roadside rooms need to be a little thicker for noise purposes and the shower doesn't have a door or curtain. Since there is no door or curtain I tend to get the floor wet when I take a shower.
reviews.title: Possibly Best Residence Inn

reviews.text: Great location also. Plenty of restaurants within a short walk.
reviews.title: Perfect!
Wonderful staff, great location
reviews.text: We had a family wedding in Portsmouth this past August most family and friends stayed at the Residence Inn as the reception was being held there, we couldn't have made a better choice. Brittany and everyone couldn't have been more accommodating and pleasant which made a wonderful wedding experience even better.

reviews.title: Convenient, Clean, & Comfortable
reviews.text: I highly recommend the Residence Inn for location, clean well appointed rooms, friendly staff, everyone was cheerful and committed to making our stay a pleasure, and Portsmouth is just a fun city to visit. We are looking forward to staying here again and enjoying the city.

reviews.title: Wonderful service at the front desk
reviews.text: Very nice hotel in Portsmouth. After a late night arrival, the friendly and knowledgeable front desk staff was quite helpful in recommending good restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. Since it was a late night check-in, any self-parking options were not readily apparent so we used the valet parking which was quick and efficient. Our room was clean and comfortable. Wireless internet access was fast and provided an easy connection. While outside, we noticed that there was a rather large wedding reception (and loud music) in progress in the facility adjacent to the hotel. The music/noise was only barely noticeable in the hotel lobby and could not be heard in the hallway or room. Overall, a pleasant experience at the Residence Inn of Portsmouth. Whenever we're back in the area, we'll stay here.

reviews.title: Great location for enjoying Portsmouth
reviews.text: Upon checking in, I was initially placed in a room on the second floor facing a rather loud construction project going on across the street. I called the front desk and asked to be moved to a different room. Even with a wedding going on and lots of other activity, Amanda and the rest of the staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and accommodating. It would have been easy to say "no" given everything else going on a the hotel, but they went out of their way to meet my request and I had a much more enjoyable stay because of it.

reviews.title: Brittany, Front Desk
reviews.text: We stayed at this Residence Inn for 4 nights and while this property is brand new there is some work that needs to be done by the staff. Check in was smooth; front desk team super friendly, helpful, and professional. This hotel has valet parking for which they hit you up for 18 bucks a day. They helped us unload the car which was huge because we were traveling with our 4 month old, so we pretty much brought all the baby gear we own. Our room was on the second floor away from the elevator and near a side exit. There really aren't any great views from this property...the "waterfront" claim is pretty misleading as you have to walk down Deer Street to catch a glimpse of the Pisqataqua River. We did have a decent view of downtown. The room layout is typical Marriott. Kitchen space, desk, sitting area in one room, bedroom and bathroom in the next room. It worked out great for us, as we could put baby to bed in one room and watch TV and relax in the living room. The downside was that there were a couple strands of hair on the shower tile. It was gross. I wiped them away and moved on. Bed was comfy, a/c worked great and was quiet. Kitchen had full refrigerator, toaster, stove top, dishwasher. Linens and soap are provided. One day we went down to the pool thinking we might go in. It was filthy! Large clumps of hair were floating in it and the water was cloudy. Disappointing. We alerted the front desk and they sent "Channing" to take care of it. Breakfast was good. Lots of space so you don't feel like you're on top of people as some other brands we've experienced. Staff was always asking guests how everything is, replenishing items, cleaning, wiping surfaces. Food was decent. Breakfast was included. The property is just a short walk to Congress and Commercial Streets. We only got our car once on a rainy day to go to LL Bean in Freeport. We took advantage of the walkability and that is really what makes this property a good choice. Side note: this property is also a major wedding destination so it can get crowded on weekends.

reviews.title: Great little get away
reviews.text: My now husband and I spent two nights here after our wedding as a little get away from the craziness a wedding brings. It was a great experience at the hotel. Bed was super comfortable, plenty of space for us to spread out our 6 months old toys and pack and play and the added perk of a full kitchen added that perfect touch. We loved the daily included breakfast that had hot and cold options which were tasty and not "fake" food. Our check in was smooth as was our check out. Room was clean, fresh and modern. I didnt hear anyone else walking around or making noise. The only downfall was that we were on the back side of the hotel away from the construction (which was good) but we heard all the in and out of the staff emptying trash or the dumpsters being emptied in the very early morning hours. But that was tolerable and didnt make my stay bad. I would definatly visit again.

reviews.title: Great Hotel in Portsmouth
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights while exploring all that the charming old city of Portsmouth has to offer. We were very satisfied with our experience. The staff is welcoming and polite. Heather, who checked us in, was a friendly and helpful presence throughout our stay. The same can be said of the other hotel personnel, including the housekeeping staff. These are people who enjoy their jobs and it shows. Our room was clean, comfortable and well-appointed. The complimentary breakfast was very good in variety, quality and freshness. And the staff members maintaining the breakfast were helpful and courteous. This hotel and its staff have earned our loyalty. We will be staying with them whenever we return to Portsmouth.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: What a great location! Located walking distance to Market Street, Congress Street. Amazing staff. Front desk staff are very accommodating to guest and any requests. Breakfast (only meal offered) included with room.

reviews.title: Great Hotel!
reviews.text: We stayed twice at the Residence Inn Portsmouth last month and loved our visits on both occasions. The rooms are clean, well-decorated and spacious with a large bathroom and wonderful walk-in shower. The hotel is conveniently located for walking in downtown Portsmouth. What made our visit there especially memorable, though, was the friendly and helpful staff from the receptionists at the front desk to the hostesses, like Marija, that help with breakfast; they all made our visit so enjoyable. One morning we mentioned to maintenance a minor problem with the bathroom door, and they had it fixed before we returned from breakfast. A great hotel for visiting Portsmouth whether on business or pleasure.

reviews.title: Solid Hotel For Extended Stays or a Quick Weekend
reviews.text: We stayed back in June for a quick weekend getaway and the bed was the best we have experienced at any Marriott. We loved the bed, from the hotel you can easily walk anywhere in Portsmouth. From the downtown area to Strawberry Banke to the Waterfront, everything is easily accessible.

reviews.title: Great Location; Accommodating Staff
reviews.text: We stayed two nights here on our way to Nova Scotia and were extremely pleased with its location, which allowed us to walk everywhere, and the accommodating staff. The included breakfast was one of the best that we have experienced. The hot food was hot and very well-prepared, and there was a fabulous variety available. The room was huge and clean. The view will eventually be limited by a new hotel across the street; however, we choose to explore new areas that we visit rather than sit in our room and stare out the window. The only drawback was that our car was parked on the street by the valet because there was no indoor parking available. This should be remedied when the hotel across the street is finished as they will have use of their garage. We would certainly stay here again.

reviews.title: Excellent, Responsive Staff, Well Maintained
reviews.text: I stay at this property when in Portsmouth for business. This Residence Inn is newer, with a wonderful attached conference/event center in addition to what the property can offer within the hotel.

reviews.title: Nice place to stay
reviews.text: There has been construction going on across the street which can cause noise later in the evening, however staff is very accommodating and normally has found a location on a higher floor on the opposite end of the building.

reviews.title: My Second Home
reviews.text: Linens have always been clean, rooms appear well maintained. I have had the pleasure of staying in each room type offered, and all have been very comfortable.

reviews.title: great location, great design
reviews.text: Stayed mid October, the staff are wonderful!! Rooms clean, updated and the service was excellent...Location is great but right now there is major construction going on just feet away from the hotel...No problem with noise...Well worth the stay....

Room included kitchenette. Bed was very firm, loved it. Bathroom was large and clean. The room overall was very clean, it's a newer property and it shows. Very good experience. Breakfast is included and served buffet style. Good selection of healthier items such as wheat muffins, oatmeal and cereal. They also serve eggs, potatoes, bacon and waffles. Once a week there is a free happy hour in the lobby. The staff members are very friendly. Check-in and out was super-fast. The location is great, you can walk to all the downtown shops and restaurants. Parking is $12 a day in the lot adjacent to the hotel. I would definitely stay there again. I stayed five nights.
reviews.title: Clean Rooms, Great Location, Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The friendly welcome at this smart hotel makes you feel right at home and our suite was very spacious and well equipped with a kitchen area, lounge, bedroom and large clean bathroom. We even had two large flat screen televisions! The location is also ideal for exploring Portsmouth with the town centre and harbour only several minutes walk away. Parking is also easy with a pay car park opposite the hotel entrance. The public rooms were spacious and comfortable and the buffet breakfast facilities and choice were good. We will definitely stay here again if we re-visit Portsmouth.
reviews.title: Excellent location, Spacious rooms

reviews.text: We stayed at the Residence Inn for three nights. Check in was very easy and the ladies at the front desk were very nice and helpful. We got two rooms - one was a large corner room with a kitchen, dining table, living room with pullout sofa and bedroom and bath. The other was right next door and was more of an efficiency, with a pullout sofa and bedroom, but still a nice size. The decor is modern and it was clean. The larger room had a walk in shower inthe bathroom and the other room had a tub/shower. We were right by the elevator, but it wasn't that noisy. There was a complimentary breakfast buffet every day with a nice variety of food. Every afternoon at three there were warm cookies waiting. The hotel has an indoor pool which we did not use, but looked very nice. There is also a workout room. This hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to the shops and restaurants in Portsmouth. There is four hour parking on the Deer Street entrance in front of the hotel with a kiosk. You don't have to pay from 7 pm until 9am. There is also a parking lot where it is .75/hour to park. We were also able to get an extended stay parking ticket for $12.00/day. They did have free parking on Thanskgiving on the street. Every staff member we came in contact with was very friendly, courteous and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great rooms and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the weekend in Portsmouth, and decided upon the Residence Inn. We have Marriott Rewards and so staying at a Marriott property is always an option.
reviews.title: Residence Inn Worked For Us

reviews.text: Overall, the Residence Inn is like others we stayed at. The room was spacious and clean, the bed was comfortable, and the room was generally quiet. Front desk service was friendly and check in was prompt and quick.
reviews.title: Don't bother with Anywhere else

reviews.text: I recently relocated from Connecticut to New Hampshire for a new position within my company. I stayed at this hotel for an extended period of time and can say that this was my favorite hotel I have stayed at! The hotel staff was excellent and extremely courteous. The rooms were very clean and were larger than most hotels that I have stayed at during my business travel.
reviews.title: Residence Inn Portsmouth Review - Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is amazing, being only about a minute walk to hundreds of great restaurants. Being able to walk to downtown is always a plus! In addition, the hotel staff always had excellent recommendations for where to have dinner and other excursions.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is visiting Portsmouth for business or pleasure.
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Portsmouth

reviews.text: We recently went up to the Portsmouth area for a girls weekend. We rented a two bedroom suite for four of us and it was perfect. Staff was helpful. The rooms were large -- we had 2 bedrooms with king sized beds and two baths, plus a living area. The rooms were very clean. We were on the 2nd floor, which was quite warm. We couldn't get the room too cool, but it wasn't unbearably hot. The first floor seemed cooler. Didn't have the breakfast there, but it looked fairly standard for that type of place. The hotel was located right off the highway and it was only a short drive into Portsmouth --- which is a great little town with tons of shops and restaurants. The hotel was right next door to the Red Hook Brewery -- great beer. Agree with another reviewer that the common areas could have used a little updating, but it wasn't a game changer. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed here multiple times since the hotel opened in 2010. Every stay has been a pleasure. The rooms are large and clean. The hotel is convenient to major highways and is two blocks from the wonderful downtown area of Portsmouth. The hotel staff is always friendly and accomodating. The complimentary breakfast is fine, especially for a quick meal. The bar in the lobby at night is a nice little "plus" after a long, tiring day.
reviews.title: Great location - room is comfortable But there is no parking included
Outstanding Studio Suite
reviews.text: This is one of the best studio suite of all the Marriott i have ever stayed before. Overall, it is impecablly clean, rooms are very cozy and roomy, friendly staff, and the best part is that they have FREE breakfast, FREE happy hours food, and FREE internet in your room. It is also centrally located with walking distant to shops and restaurants. The front desk staff is also outstanding and I must mention that the person who attend the Breakfast room is also extremely attendtive...outstanding service. Only one bad thing is that they have limited cable channels (no food TV network channel). But I will stay here again!

reviews.title: Amazing hotel!
reviews.text: We had a wonderful 3-night stay at this hotel in late December 2011, to rejuvenate after a busy Christmas season.

reviews.title: Great location for the walkable city of Portsmouth
reviews.text: The rooms are HUGE and very well-appointed. Also exceptionally clean and well-maintained. Fantastic bed and linen, beautiful large windows, everything you could possibly need in the kitchen area and a modern, well-decorated and functioning bath.

reviews.title: Can't beat the location
reviews.text: It was very quiet at night, and we slept well.

reviews.title: Great Location & Property
reviews.text: We walked the Portsmouth downtown while there (twice), went into many quaint shops, and enjoyed several local restaurants (great seafood!) It also has easy access to the beach and to Kittery, Maine, for lots of outlet shopping.

aka: Residence Inn Portsmouth Downtown / Waterfront Hotel
description: Located next to the new Portsmouth Harbor Events & Conference Center, Residence Inn Portsmouth Downtown is Portsmouth’s only LEED Certified Hotel. Steps away from a wide variety of boutiques, theaters, galleries, historic homes and waterfront gardens, plus, dining options are endless with Dolphin Striker, Oar House and Portsmouth Brewery just a block away. Our all-suite, extended-stay hotel is pet-friendly, offering such amenities as an indoor pool, fitness center, on-site bar and complimentary hot breakfast.
